title: Police Records Specialist
company_name: Metropolitan Council of the Twin Cities
description:
We are the Metropolitan Council, the regional government for the seven-county Twin Cities metropolitan area. We plan 30 years ahead for the future of the metropolitan area and provide regional transportation, wastewater, and housing services. More information about us on our website.
We are committed to supporting a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve.
The Metro Transit Police Department is one of the fastest growing law enforcement agencies in the state due the expansion of light rail and Rapid Transit Bus systems. There is an authorized strength of 171 full-time officers, 80 part-time officers, 70 community service officers and 34 administrative staff dedicated to one thing: public safety on and near our transit system.
How your work would contribute to our organization and the Twin Cities region:
The Police Records Specialist applies specialized skills in the case management of all physical and electronic Metro Transit Police Department (MTPD) documents. Thoroughly reviews, interprets, and approves all documents following guidelines set by city, state, and federal agencies to ensure that true and complete data is available for statistical analysis and dissemination.Note: This position will work four 10-hour early morning shifts.This posting will establish a six (6) month eligibility list for current and future positions.
What you would do in this job:
Manage police records by creating, reviewing, approving, and coding through the utilization of the Field Based Reporting (FBR) database ensuring accurate and thorough data is collected for dissemination.Disseminate MTPD documents as requested to internal and external entities: redact police reports following the statutes provided by the Minnesota Data Practices Act; respond to requests from City/County Courts, Law Enforcement Agencies, Metropolitan Council Departments, Insurance Agencies, Law Firms, and the General Public.Validate both Advanced Public Safety (APS) and handwritten citations.Manage the access of Metropolitan Council employees, vendors, and contractors to MTPD buildings and logical data according to Bureau of Criminal Apprehension (BCA) standards by processing background information and creating accounts in the Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) and NexTest.Maintain confidential information in multiple law enforcement programs that require advanced administrative skills to ensure accurate information is disseminated.Report monthly data for statistical use and accurate crime reporting within BCA and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).Provide in-person/virtual training and help desk support for MTPD staff.Perform administrative tasks to support the daily operations and data management for the Records Unit.
Minimum qualifications:Any of the following combinations of experience (working for a Law Enforcement Agency or similar field such as Corrections, Attorney’s Office, Dispatch, or Courts) and completed education (in Law Enforcement, Criminal Justice, Political Science, Police Dispatch, Records Management, or related field): High school diploma/GED with five (5) years of experience. Associates degree with three (3) years of experience.Bachelor’s degree, or higher, with one (1) year of experience.

title: CNC Operator 2nd Shift
description:
CNC Operator 

2nd Shift

Location: Hanover, PA

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

The Aerospace Business Unit is responsible for Aerospace applications with a global responsibility for Sales, Manufacturing, Business development, Product and Process Development. The Business Unit operates in a large number of countries and markets, all over the world and with a customer portfolio that includes all major players in the Aerospace industry. Our business is fully customer focused, with products specifically designed for an engine / airframe application and then produced in small quantities and small lots on highly flexible equipment. Extreme product range fragmentation, complex product design, very high-quality standards and traceability requirements are the peculiarity of our Business Unit. In Hanover, PA we produce Rings and Seals for the Aerospace and Industrial markets. The CNC Machine Operator will analyze design specifications, cut/shape metal, assemble parts and test completed products for use and will work in the Shaft Seal Mori Line Department. Due to the nature of the work, US citizenship is required.

Responsibilities

Operate a variety of equipment and perform operations necessary to produce acceptable aerospace and industrial products within the following operations: Sealing Rings CNC Line, milling, turning, boring and abrasive machining procedures. Duties include working from prints, sketches, process sheets, travelers, and verbal instructions.Use of precision measuring instruments such as micrometers, air gage, dial, indicator, depth feeler gage to measure width, wall face width, step height, depth angle, to tolerances generally within .001", occasionally as close as .0001".Setup and adjustments line.Transport materials; perform dipping, coating, and wrapping of products as needed.Perform operator capable lubrication of service to machines and equipment.Set up and operate Lapping Room equipment as needed.Maintain records and paperwork.Ensure that work area is kept clean, safe and orderly.Notify supervision of any problems or difficulties.Refers to supervisor for clarification of priorities, objectives, or policies. 

EQUIPMENT USED - Including And Not Limited To

Abrasive Machinery: O.D. & I.D. grinders, large O.D. & I.D. grinders, burring & Jt burring, lap, Hyprolap, creep feed grinders. Conventional Machinery: Lathes, Cam, Grooving & Chamfering.

Requirements

Due to the nature of the work, US citizenship is required.All hourly employees will be part of the United Steelworkers Union (USW).HSD or GED required.Requires use of complicated drawings, specifications, charts, etc. & a variety of precision measuring instruments and devices. Manufacturing experience a plus.Able to effectively work in an environment requiring independent judgment, and self-motivation with customer focus. Ability to stand for 8-hours per day, 5-days per week.Ability to lift up to 35 pounds.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a robust vacation policy and 14 paid holidays! No Mandatory Overtime!

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace! We actively develop ourselves and our teams to enable outstanding delivery. We trust the strength of diverse teams and encourage agile ways of working.

Health and Wellness Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Many options for best in class medical and dental plans to fit your needs, and a wellness plan. Health and welfare benefits begins on the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment.

Invest in your Future. SKF offers amazing retirement options! Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 3% of all eligible 401k earnings contribution (100% Vested after 1 year of service).

SKF Cares! The four fundamental cornerstones of SKF Care – Business, Environment, Employees, and the Community are critical for us to sustain long-term success.

Much more! Growth opportunities, voluntary critical illness coverage, voluntary legal plan, employee assistance program, life insurance, vehicle discount programs, mobile phone discounts, and with so many benefits to working for SKF, we could not name them all!

Location: Hanover, PA 2nd Shift (3PM-11PM)

Familiar with Mori-Seiki/Fanuc controllers.Siemens NX CAD/CAM design.Hard turning/Milling/Fixture design.CNC Multi-Axis Grinding/Honing/Work Holding design.

description:

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

Install and move machinery, shafting, and belts, and perform other related assignments.Maintain building central systems and related plumbing.Must possess required EPA certifications for HVAC repair.Follow prints or sketches and other written specifications.Perform safety checks of lifting devices.

Key Responsibilities

Receive assignment pertaining to operation to be performed specifying location and general nature of work and general and special instructions when necessary.Use sketch or print prepared by supervisor, Engineering Department, and or manufacturer’s specification, when necessary.Unload machines, or the disassembled parts of machines, from trucks using a hoist or jacks, crowbars, and wooden blocks.Prepare foundation for a machine.Outline appropriate size and dig hole to required depth (when laborers not available).Prepare and line hole with wooden forms; fill form with cement.Transfer machinery, on rollers or with assistance of power lift truck; place base or machine on foundation, as required.Assemble remaining parts as indicated in sketch, print or specification and adjust for operation.Cut, thread, and bend pipe as required.Install valves and accessories.Move machinery or equipment as directed.Dismantle unit.Use various equipment to remove machine from foundation.Transfer to new location; lift into place, level, and secures.Re-assemble unit and prepare it for operation.Build wall partitions, etc., using sheet metal, wood, glass, and other building material.Repack glands on designated pumps; change filters in intake and exhaust systems.Repair/replace vacuum pumps, exterior plumbing, and machine drops (vacuum, compressed air, nitrogen, chiller liquid), vent stacks and associated equipment related to heat treat furnaces and equipment.Replace worn flooring in plant; perform major and minor concrete repairs within plant and to walks, and drives, repair roof by applying cold tar.Service and repair rooftop and stand-alone HVAC units. Maintain burners, air balance and flow, program controls, humidification, controls, compressors, refrigerants, and EPA certification.Maintain central coolant systems.Maintain/repair all compressed air lines and machine drops.Unblock clogged pipes and remove and replace, if necessary.Repair/maintain municipal water systems, valves, faucets etc.Perform electric arc and oxyacetylene welding, rough carpentry, painting, plumbing, and sheet metal work, as necessary.Fabrication of sheet metal guards and chutesMonthly inspect hoisting equipment for W9m or chains, loose brakes, etc., lubricate according to instructions.Other duties as assigned.

High School diploma or GEDMust possess a certified Journeyman card. Must maintain a valid Forklift license.Physical Requirements: Stooping, climbing, lifting, walking, using hoists, rollers, hand trucks, climbing up and down ladders, aerial platforms, accessing confined spaces, etc.

description:
Location: Muskegon, MI

Union Position: Full Time, Permanent Position

Due to the nature of the business: U.S. Citizenship is required.

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. Job Description

This position is responsible for the repair and maintenance of mechanical and hydraulic components of production machines and equipment such as metal fabricating, machine tools, material-handling system,and automated lubrication system. You will be expected to ensure that equipment and machinery are in proper operating condition to maximize production and minimize down time. This position is also responsible for general building maintenance. Prior experience in the repair of CNC equipment is required for this position. Due to the nature of the business, candidates must be US Citizens. This is a Union Position.

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Complete periodic machine tool preventive maintenance to ensure machine availability and reliability performance. Troubleshoot, repair and overhaul electrical/mechanical systems like pumps, gearboxes, ball screws, slide assemblies and other drive mechanisms.Knowledge of all standard measuring equipment including the proper use of micrometers, calipers and dial indicators. Ability to complete fabrication projects from drawings by using tool room equipment, such as engine lathe, milling machine, drill press and welding equipment. Perform installation and set-up of new equipment as necessary.Operate forklift when required.Must be able to work with CMMS system to record work orders and preventative maintenance schedules. Responsible for maintaining a clean and safe environment including identification of unsafe conditions. Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in a manufacturing environment performing repairs to machinery, basic equipment and general facility maintenance. High School Diploma or GED minimum. Experience with CNC machine repair is highly preferred.Must possess a high degree of mechanical aptitude and the ability to work with hand tools (welding, wrenches, etc.) in mechanically oriented situations. Good working knowledge of plumbing, electrical, construction, hydraulics, and pneumatics.Ability to read, write and to follow detailed written instructions. Ability to lift up to 40 pounds, stand, sit, bend and move freely about the plant. At a minimum, steel toed or composite shoes and ANSI approved safety glasses with side shields are required.Due to the nature of the business: U.S. Citizenship is required.

What You’ll Love About SKF

title: Private Equity Analyst
description:

This extends to all of our employees and clients who work with us. Overview:We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Private Equity Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Private Equity Analyst, you will play a critical role in evaluating investment opportunities, conducting financial analysis, and supporting the overall investment decision-making process. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, financial modeling expertise, and a keen understanding of the private equity landscape.Responsibilities:Financial Analysis:Conduct comprehensive financial analysis, including building and maintaining complex financial models to evaluate potential investment opportunities.Analyze historical and projected financial statements, cash flow, and valuation metrics.Due Diligence:Perform due diligence on target companies, assessing industry dynamics, competitive positioning, and growth prospects.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze relevant information.Market Research:Stay abreast of industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities.Prepare market research reports to inform investment strategies and decisions.Investment Memo Preparation:Prepare detailed investment memoranda, outlining the investment thesis, risks, and potential returns.Present findings and recommendations to senior management and investment committees.Deal Execution:Assist in the execution of investment transactions, including mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts, and recapitalizations.Coordinate due diligence processes and work with legal and financial advisors.Portfolio Management:Monitor and report on the performance of existing portfolio companies.Work closely with portfolio management teams to identify value creation opportunities.Valuation and Exit Strategies:Participate in the valuation of portfolio companies and assess potential exit strategies.Evaluate exit opportunities, such as IPOs, secondary sales, and strategic exits.Risk Management:Identify and assess investment risks, proposing strategies to mitigate risks and enhance returns.Stay informed about regulatory changes and their potential impact on investments.
Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or a related field; CFA or MBA is a plus.Previous experience in private equity, investment banking, or a related field.Strong financial modeling and valuation skills.Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.Effective communication and presentation skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
Learn More:https://www.augmentjobs.com/

title: Banking Operations Systems Analyst
description:
The Banking Operations Systems Analyst is responsible for assisting bank staff with deep technical support, implementation, and maintenance on banking operations products and services. This critical operational support role for the Bank will act as a liaison between software and service providers, banking teams, and bank staff to promote clear communication across the organization, transparency on our products and services, and overall support for the TM business.
ResponsibilitiesActs as a technical and software product expert for banking operations products and systems, deeply understanding how our operations systems function, interact with one another and how to troubleshoot complex client issues.Assists the Banking Operations teams with Jack Henry core banking problem resolution, investigating problems against previously understood issues and resolving as appropriate. If problem resolution requires vendor support, you will own the issue from start to finish, working with vendor and troubleshooting issue in tandem.Develop, execute, and maintain automated processes for high volume tasks via standardized vendor supported tools such as Macros and RPA, including reporting functions for Banking Operations teams.Continually supports all Banking Operations products and services, including primary interface with core service provider for deposit product related issues.Identify and implement process and system function improvements.Other duties as assigned.
Minimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree preferred.3-4 years of experience in Computer Science or Systems Management.Experience implementing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) technology.Database management experience preferred.Ability to develop and maintain knowledge of Treasury Management products and services.Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite applications required.Ability to communicate effectively with team members and external clients.Can work well under pressure with the capability to always remain calm and courteous, especially when handling difficult calls and requests.Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to offer recommendations and/or solutions to complex client inquires/issues.


About Fortis
At Fortis, we take great pride in providing our clients with a holistic and sophisticated banking experience. Our people enjoy being empowered with the ability to make a tangible impact in a progressive and less bureaucratic work culture that can often be a struggle for larger institutions. 
We strongly believe in hiring people greater than ourselves. We recognize, reward, and develop those individuals who make an outsized impact to the business. Our combined passion, hard work, and proactive thinking allows us to simultaneously empower our clients and each other.
Established in May 1997 and rebranded in 2016, Fortis is a high growth commercial bank located in Colorado and Utah. Our flagship office is in Denver, Colorado, and was designed as a place for our clients to relax while our banking teams offer solutions to exceed their goals. Each of our hand-selected and exceptionally talented teammates contribute to the heart of our company culture that combines banking expertise and personalized services to create an unparalleled level of client experience.
We have over $1.3 billion in total assets and are insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (the “FDIC”).We are ranked the 10th largest bank in the state of Colorado, the 859th largest bank in the nation, and we have three (3) locations and approximately 80 employees.
Learn more today at www.fortisprivatebank.com/careers.

title: Sales Assistant (Full-Time)
description:
Description

Want a challenging, inclusive work culture that emphasizes personal development and recognition? Are you a motivated, goal-oriented professional looking to take an exciting and rewarding step towards greatness in your career? New Home Star may be the place for you!

Our company is looking for a New Home Sales Assistant with experience in sales, customer service, and/or real estate to add to our nationwide team. As a New Home Sales Assistant, you have the opportunity to participate in the building of the American Dream. New Home Star is the largest privately owned seller of new homes in America. You can join us in a role in assisting the sales team for a division in the capacity of staffing the model, administrative tasks, and marketing assistance. Your role in this process is crucial, as you will act as a resource to the sales team. This role is located in Lady Lake, FL with our builder partner, Sun Communities.

Why New Home Star?

At New Home Star, our number one core value is to provide excellent careers for our people! By joining our team, you will see this value emphasized in all aspects of your career.

 Development Potential - opportunities for growth into full-time roles and continuous learning.  Award-Winning Culture - with thoughtful recognition and opportunities to participate in local and national team bonding events.  Excellent Health & Wellness Benefits- access to our range of benefits and wellness program, generous paid time off, and an exceptional employee assistance program.  Volunteer Opportunities - encouraged time and financial resources to give back to your local community in meaningful ways. 

Pay Structure & Benefits

This is a full-time job with an hourly pay of $23. Saturday availability is required. Advancement to Sales Consultant role after 3-6 months. Paid time off- vacation time, paid sick and safe time(PSST), and paid company holidays. Access to Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance. Comes with generous company contributions to premiums (subject to all eligibility requirements). Options for Health Savings Account with a company contribution or Flexible Spending Account; for medical and dependent care expense. Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability Insurance. Employee Assistance Program is available to you and members of your household. The EAP provides resources to help with childcare and elder care, financial and legal assistance, counseling and well-being coaching, personal and professional development. 401(k) retirement plan with a company match on your contributions. Student Loan Resources, the ability to control and prioritize your financial wellness with the assistance of Peanut Butter. Available Discounts for both your daily and splurge expense through PerkSpot. Negotiable gas stipend for traveling available. 

Requirements

New Home Star is seeking an educated, motivated, and goal-oriented sales professional to assist our sales team. If you fit the requirements below, you are an ideal match for this position!

Must have weekend availability. High School diploma is required, some college is preferred. 1-3 years of experience in an administrative or professional role is preferred. Extreme attention to detail and time management skills are a necessity. Ability to multitask and prioritize projects will be needed in order to be successful in this role. Experience with MS Office Suites such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Background checks required. 

Responsibilities

Staff the sales office location and provide exceptional customer service and information to any visitors. General office duties, including answering phones and responding to emails. Greeting office visitors and clients as they walk into the office. The ability to succeed in a high customer traffic environment. The ability to build rapport quickly with each customer. A base understanding of current technology for both reporting and social media. This position requires some Saturday and Sunday work hours. 

Applying Instructions

Ready to take the next step in your career? Follow the link below to check out New Home Star’s Careers Page! Please note, you only need to apply to one job ad, and list the other areas of interest you currently see posted. When applying there will be an option to list all of your areas of interest.

https://www.newhomestar.com/careers

Excited to learn more about our award-winning company? Check out our social media profiles! You can find New Home Star on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and even Youtube.

https://www.newhomestar.com/company/about

The preceding job description is not a comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities required of a new home sales assistant.

New Home Star does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other reason prohibited by law in the provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Not open to third-party recruitment agencies.

title: Assistant Claims Examiner (Onsite Atlanta GA.)
description:
Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.

Summary

As an Assistant Claims Examiner (Onsite Atlanta GA.) at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Here are the details on this position.

Your role in our mission

Perform important work in one of the most important areas of supporting state healthcare programs.

 Support state Medicaid recovery efforts while following state law to ensure timely case management  Do the research on assets and probate, file court claims, work with stakeholders on case management, resolve outstanding issues and collect payment  Connect directly with attorneys and family members via phone or email regarding case status and when more information is needed to process a claim  Evaluate case information to validate asset information and probate case status  Advance cases to recovery by preparing the required correspondence, liens, claims and other related documents  Determine the payment amount and obtain the approval needed to disburse payments  Escalate contested cases to leadership as appropriate 

What we're looking for

 Probate, legal document and/or asset research/investigation work experience preferred  Knowledge of basic principles of case management with basic exposure to probate, LexisNexis, legal documents and Medicaid preferred  Basic investigative and problem-solving skills to evaluate cases and determine actions required  Strong written and oral communication skills to interact with external attorneys, family members and courts  Ability to pay close attention to detail and legal deadlines to ensure quality and timeliness of case management 

What you should expect in this role

Onsite Atlanta, GA. 

The pay range for this position is $26,500.00 - $37,800.00 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits , and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.

We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.

title: Maintenance Manager
description: The Maintenance Manager will be based in our ATLANTA REGIONAL office. title: IT QA Engineer II
description:
At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you’ll have the opportunity to create exceptional, meaningful work and problem solve with innovative team members by your side. Together, you’ll help our customers get the high-quality gear they need to make the most of their adventures. We are BUILT FOR THE WILD™.

At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you’ll have the opportunity to create exceptional, meaningful work and problem solve with innovative team members by your side. Together, you’ll help our customers get the high-quality gear they need to make the most of their adventures. We are BUILT FOR THE WILD™.

YETI is rapidly transforming our foundational technologies in enterprise applications, consumer technologies, and data analytics. Are you passionate about working across multiple teams to build innovative technology systems? Do you thrive on turning ambiguity into clarity? Do you enjoy helping projects move from being an idea to becoming a valuable technical system? This role provides you with an opportunity to engage with many different Technology teams across YETI as we implement and operate best-in-class quality assurance and testing practices.

This role will impact the delivery quality of multiple large Information Technology initiatives. The QA Test Lead must be able to work cross-functionally communicate up and down within the Information Technology and Finance organizations, manage testing schedules, create test plans, cultivate precise test scripts, and coordinate execution of SIT and UAT efforts. The successful candidate will interface with our Information Technology teams and participate in continuous improvement of our methodologies. This position resides within the IT Program Management Office (PMO.).

Responsibilities

 Plan, develop, and execute test strategy across products and platforms Establish QA/Test Methodologies, including SIT and UAT processes. Evolve QA processes and scale testing efforts across multiple technologies. Define quality metrics to ensure each step of the testing process is documented and tracked for risks, gaps, or issues Enable improved replication of testing practices to optimize future testing Lead the implementation of a contemporary functional testing tool across IT, with collaboration of multiple stakeholder Departments Develop, maintain, and operationalize test plans Streamline manual and automated testing across enterprise architectures Ability to break down organizational silos and facilitate test information among IT teams Communicate the status of testing initiatives and drive cross-functional departments during SIT and UAT testing Work with project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution

Attributes

Inspiring Coach – Thrives on sharing knowledge and skills with others, and leads learning by example

Omniscient Nice - Can know it all without being a know-it-all

Many Hats - A business person, a technologist, a leader, a facilitator, an administrator

Balance – Values working hard as much as giving back to others

Fearless - Not afraid to suggest or back big ideas

Tenacious - Able to push back and focus on the project’s lifecycle to achieve our goals

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college, or equivalent experience At least 2 years of experience in testing, automation, performance, and load and security testing Experience with contemporary test automation software such as UFT One, Katalon, or Tosca Experience with Scrum, Kanban, and/or Lean/Six Sigma Experience working with global, hybrid teams and project resources Demonstrate expertise in understanding documented business processes as applied to test script generation Thorough knowledge of contemporary Software Development Life Cycle practices Demonstrable competency with Atlassian Tools and/or MS DevOps Experience working with cross-functional teams Skilled in communications with executive leadership Collaborative: Ability to work well with internal and 3rd parties to guide delivery our systems Agilist: A proponent for Agile/Lean frameworks A current and valid ISTQB Foundational Level certification is highly preferred A current and valid ISTQB Advanced or Expert certification is preferred 2 plus years of hands-on Quality Assurance experience in which you played a key role in building and enhancing a QA function Experience with SAP S/4HANA , SFSC and SFCC strongly preferred Agile and/or PMI certification(s) strongly preferred Exceptional written, verbal and strong presentation skills Position is based in Austin, TX at our corporate headquarters at least 3 days a week onsite

title: Test Engineer
description:
Location: Plymouth, MI

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

To manage the execution of testing projects related to the validation of bearing and sealing systems and to support product development.

Job Duties and Responsibilities are (including but not limited to):

Review test requests for feasibility and propose test plan to meet customer needs.Review and apply testing specifications to meet test requirements.Design test fixtures and prepare detail and assembly drawings.Coordinate with external suppliers for tooling cost and timing.Participate in department resource planning meetings.Work with technicians to verify test rig setups are correct.Program test rig parameters and data acquisition systems.Collect test data and analyze test samples to document results.Troubleshoot test machine performance issues and assist in repair / improvements.Act as technical resource to application engineering and sales departments.Prepare test reports.Perform other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Competence Requirements, And Desired Experiences

Ability to read and understand test specification and procedures.Effective verbal and written communication with global internal groups.Data acquisitions systems and statistical analysis.Root cause determination and post-test damage characterization.Mechanical testing experience with hydraulic and pneumatic test equipment.Experience with load cells, thermocouples, transducers, and measuring systems.Experience with project management and related software to manage project timelines.3D Parametric Design Software experience.Experience with LabVIEW software.Experience with bearings, Automotive chassis, Automotive powertrain systems, industrial, and/or agricultural systems.

Education And Experience Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering.Minimum of two years of experience in a testing laboratory or related technical field.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Location: Plymouth, MI

title: Global Graduate, Aerospace
description:
Aerospace Global Graduate

Location: Ladson, SC

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer that's dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth.

SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Global Graduate Program Summary

Through the 18-month paid rotational Global Graduate Program, you will get broad experience from various SKF areas and a great opportunity to found a solid international professional network. You will get to know the company through international and cross functional rotations and by working in real projects. Your rotations will be individually designed based on your interests and our business needs. To ensure maximum growth, you will have mentors assigned, supporting you throughout the whole program.

The introduction and program gatherings, in which you will get training within several areas (such as leadership, project management and business knowledge), are spent together with the full Global Graduate group. This means that you, upon completion of the Global Graduate Program, will have a solid platform to leverage a career within SKF.

With This Program We Offer

An 18-month learning experience with permanent employment with SKF.Several individually designed, cross functional rotations with possibilities abroad.The opportunity to participate in, or manage, real projects in a global environment.Vast professional development and growth throughout the whole program.Extensive Project Management & Leadership trainings and experience.A solid professional network – both locally as well as globally.Gatherings with lots of fun together with your Global Graduate colleagues.

Role/Rotation Description

Project management (MRO focus). First project will focus on the MRO business and operations at our repair center in Ladson, SC with the goal of stabilizing and improving performance. Subsequent rotations will also be repair-focused.Location, function and business unit will be based on candidate’s ambition and needs of the business. 

Requirements

Minimum Bachelor´s degree within STEM field or business, in combination with extracurricular activities. Master’s degree preferred. Demonstrated entrepreneurial and innovative mind-set and experience. International and cross culture experiences, preferably from travel and studied/working abroad.0-2 years of working experience post Bachelor’s or Master’s graduation.English working proficiency.Must be a citizen of the United States. 

Successful Attributes And Skills

You actively seek new perspectives and ideas and have effective communication skills. You are resourceful and curious, with ability to efficiently challenge status quo.You collaborate effectively with people from various backgrounds and cultures.You demonstrate willingness and flexibility to move between different functions.Others would most likely describe you as someone who openly share ideas and as the continuous learner who puts emphasis on own and others growth.

What SKF Offers

The opportunity to work in an innovative and well-equipped professional environment that is part of a global company with an excellent reputation. You will join a team of highly motivated colleagues, who will work with you and look forward to seeing you develop your career with SKF.

Job Description

The performance program leader is responsible to successfully implement a performance-based contract at one of SKF’s strategic industrial end user customers. The individual will work onsite at the end user and manage all aspects of the condition monitoring program whose goal is to increase rotating equipment performance at the facility.

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Lead delivery of KPI’s and outcomes based on contractual obligations. Vibration analysis of at least an ISO Category III. Work with other predictive maintenance technologies and practices including electrical and mechanical infrared inspections, In-place dynamic balancing, airborne ultrasound inspections, machinery alignment, ODS, and Motion Amplification. Troubleshoot complex machinery problems. Perform multi-channel data analysis. Utilize CMMS and planning & scheduling tools. Manage scope, schedule, and budget for the performance contract. Build partnership with end user team while identifying opportunities for rotating equipment improvement. Coordinate activities for the effective use of all SKF resources who are part of the program team. Facilitate completion of bearing inspections, RCFA, and remanufacturing processes using best practices. Coordinate plant rebuild processes & quality with third parties to ensure rebuilds are delivered in precision state. Drive preparation and execution of operations reviews with the end user; present successes and challenges.

Mechanical Engineering or relevant degree/experience required. Vibration analysis of at least an ISO Category III. 5+ years of experience working in an industrial continuous process environment. Strong in Microsoft Office 365 applications and other computer tools. Working knowledge of CMMS and planning & scheduling. Proven leader who can build and drive a team to achieve program goals. Effective communicator who can drive activities/improvements with urgency and high quality. Ability to collaborate well with cross-functional teams to accomplish multiple assignments and deliverables in a complex environment. Sound understanding and demonstrated experience working with other predictive maintenance technologies and practices including electrical and mechanical infrared inspections, In-place dynamic balancing, airborne ultrasound inspections, machinery alignment, ODS, and Motion Amplification. Proven experience including certification or equivalent with machinery vibration analysis of at least an ISO Category III.

title: Associate Communications Specialist - Transit Control Center
company_name: Metropolitan Council of the Twin Cities
description:
We are the Metropolitan Council, the regional government for the seven-county Twin Cities metropolitan area. We plan 30 years ahead for the future of the metropolitan area and provide regional transportation, wastewater, and housing services. More information about us on our website.
We are committed to supporting a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve.
Metro Transit is one of the country's largest transit systems, employs more than 3,000 people, and prior to COVID provided more than 80 million rides a year through an integrated network of buses, light rail and commuter trains, as well as resources for those who carpool, vanpool, walk or bike in the Twin Cities.
How your work would contribute to our organization and the Twin Cities region:
The Associate Communications Specialist works in the Transit Control Center and is responsible for monitoring, answering, and coordinating response to public safety texts from the public through Metro Transit's Text for Safety. The position communicates service disruption information to passengers in real time and other service disruptions via SMS messaging, social media sources, and Metro Transit's app. The position also reviews real-time detours including bus stop closures, special events, construction projects, travel time delays, etc., and communicates to the customer in easily understood terminology. In addition, the position has access to real-time transit information, Metro Transit CCTV Cameras, and other resources to monitor transit services.
NOTE: This position is rated essential and works onsite at the Transit Control Center. The Transit Control Center operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and 365 days a year. Shifts will cover varying hours working nights, weekends and holidays. Training hours for the first four weeks will vary based on business needs and may include daytime and afternoon hours.
Anticipated Hiring Salary Range: $31.54/hr. or $65,603/yr. to $37.63/hr. or $78,270/yr.Full Salary Range: $31.54/hr. or $65,603/yr. to $51.20/hr. or $106,496/yr.** The salary displayed is the full salary range. The hiring salary will be determined based on the final candidate's qualifications, the Council's internal pay structures, and our total compensation package for the position. **
This position will create a six-month eligible list for current and future positions.
 What you would do in this job:1. Receive, interpret, and answer public safety related text messages from the public for resolution:Gather pertinent information from the customer in order determine appropriate response for Metro Transit Police or other resources.Enter data into Metro Transit's computer aided dispatch.Coordinate with Transit Police Dispatch to ensure appropriate and timely response is achieved for public safety text messages.2. Post real-time service disruptions, running time issues, event impacts, etc., to various social media sites:Review and track all real-time system disruptions and detours to maintain accurate information posting on various social media sites, metrotransit.org, and other media sources as determined.Use Metro Transit's computer aided dispatch to monitor service disruptions and detours and future postings via detour application.Assist in monitoring social media sites for customer posts related to complaints, concerns, commendations, and questions. Respond or post in response to customers as determined by agency policy. 3. Communicate with customers using various digital channels:Translate transit jargon into a format that is easily understood by customers.Determine how to best serve the customer based on information received by understanding the agency structure and department responsibilities.Monitor real-time information and make decisions regarding communications with the public following Metro Transit policy and procedure.Enter and disseminate real time rider alerts to passengers. 4. Complete administrative tasks for TCC Operations as needed.
Minimum qualifications:Any of the following combinations of experience navigating, posting, editing, and responding to social media sites and completed education in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Journalism, or closely related field:High school diploma/GED with four (4) years of experience navigating, posting, editing, and responding to social media sites.Associate's degree with two (2) years of experience navigating, posting, editing, and responding to social media sites. Bachelor’s degree or higher navigating, posting, editing, and responding to social media sites.
Complete job posting and apply:https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/metrocouncil

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
West Paw is looking to hire a dynamic Vice President of Sales. This position is responsible for leadership of the Sales team, through the development and implementation of solutions-oriented strategies that drive consistent, profitable revenue growth, and expand our distribution footprint. The Vice President of Sales is also a key contributor to West Paw's strategic direction and execution as a member of the Executive Team. The position leads, inspires, and develops five to seven direct reports across Sales and Customer Experience and reports to the President.
At West Paw, our goal is to be “Dog’s Best Friend”. We do this by making things dogs love and by caring about how we make the things dogs love - from our own factory in beautiful Bozeman, Montana. We innovate to unleash joy between people and pets, in pursuit of a healthier world. We’re eco-friendly in our materials and manufacturing choices and people-friendly in our business choices.
The talented, dog-loving, sustainability driven team at West Paw designs, manufactures, markets and ships high quality, planet and people conscious dog products to over 40 countries and 6000 retailers. From our eco-friendly facility in Bozeman, we pride ourselves on products that are safe, healthy, durable and made responsibly.
We’re West Paw, a proud Certified B Corp and Dog’s Best Friend®. To be the best fit we actively seek purpose-driven candidates that embrace the love of dogs, a curiosity to understand and passion for our vision of a better society and environment. Our best days at work often involve sharing a great dog experience that brought connection and joy.
Where Is This Role Based?Because of the collaborative nature of the role, we expect the person we hire to be based at our Bozeman, Montana, headquarters. What Will This Job Do?Lead the sales function to deliver strategic, consistent, and profitable sales growth in line with targets.Strategically participate in cultivating and managing select key accounts and new business development.Develop and implement highly effective, standardized, and proven sales processes, systems, and fulfillment partnerships that fuel sustainable growth and are aligned with our Core Values.Build and deliver an annual sales plan, informed by the growth opportunities in our market, our internal capabilities, and strong partnership with Marketing, Operations, and Finance. Establish and implement short and long-range sales goals with applicable metrics to achieve the plan.Develop short and long-term current and new customer growth strategies and partnership plans with a solutions-oriented approach. Ensure their voice informs our proposals and creates success for them, but also increases value for West Paw, all while building and protecting our brand and managing risk.Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of our distribution channels to optimize margin and revenue and determine the best short and long-term strategy for each, factoring in production capacity and other available resources.Work with all internal sales team members to establish maintenance and growth plans for all key accounts.Lead the Customer Experience team to be efficient and responsive in customer communication, creating an overwhelmingly positive brand experience that drives customer loyalty.Deliver revenue growth at or above Plan by holding sales team members accountable and providing impactful coaching on how to effectively sell.Optimize the team’s work breakdown; ensure the team is right-sized for output, efficiency, and results.Recruit, develop, and retain the right people in the right seats across our Sales and Customer Experience teams.Become a market expert and builder of strategic industry network and personal relationships.Influence, support, and champion the strategic direction and financial success of West Paw.Provide leadership and tactical coordination in strategic business planning and budgeting.Leverage strong leadership and communication skills to inspire and engage employees to envision and implement solutions that improve customer experience, grow revenue, cash flow and profit.Leverage financial and business data to make strategic and tactical decisions that drive excellence in Sales and also inform decisions in Marketing, Customer Experience, Product Development, and Operations.Ensure employees’ work is safe, they have opportunities to grow, and are recognized for value they create.Embody West Paw Core Values in all work interactions, tasks, and decisions (Create Joyful Connection, Grow for Good, Humanize Business, Be Real, Solve for Tomorrow).Uphold West Paw’s Purpose in all work endeavors (We spark opportunities to unleash good).Champion West Paw’s Niche in all work decisions (Sustainable dog solutions for their devoted humans).Other duties as assigned.
What Skills and Experience Are We Looking For?Proven track record in developing and leading a sales organization that consistently meets or exceeds expectations and has grown year over yearKnowledge of consumer goods, retail environment, marketing, branding and distributionAble to understand customer need and produce positive results for both West Paw and the customerStrong negotiation, oral and written communication skills with all ranges of individuals and groups, whether internally or externally Exceptional interpersonal skills, able to work collaboratively, practice attentive and active listening, and build constructive and effective relationships at all levels of an organizationIdentify and resolve problems collaboratively and in a timely mannerSpeak and write clearly and informatively, listen and gains clarification, demonstrate group presentation skillsAble to delegate, inspire others to perform well, and set expectationsContribute to a positive team spirit, give and welcome feedbackGather data and analyze information skillfully, able to use data to produce an informedWilling to make decisions and exhibits sound judgmentWork within an approved budget, maximize use of organizational resourcesPrioritize and plan work activities, use time efficientlyDemonstrate accuracy and thoroughnessAble to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulationsPossess solid computer skills including knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, internet, e-commerce and database software
What Are Our Minimum Qualifications for this Role?15 years related sales experience at a managerial or executive levelProven success in managing a team to meet, exceed, and grow revenue targets.Proven experience developing and managing successful and proven sales processes that enable sales teams to manage their sales pipelines, move to close, maintain world-class customer relationships, and continuously grow the business year over year.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
What are the Physical Requirements of this Role? How about the Work Environment?Typically located in an indoor area with the possibility of mild discomfort from factors such as dust, material particles, temperature extremes, loud noise and bright lights Frequent periods are spent standing or sitting in the same location with some opportunity move aboutFrequent use of a computer, keyboard, and mouseOccasional lifting of objects up to 36 inches from floor level, and weighing up to 30 lbs Frequent travel to headquarters, customer, and additional business related events 8-16 times per year
What are the Benefits and Perks of Working at West Paw?We are proud to offer a variety of benefits that meet the diverse needs of our team:Three medical plan options, with one that is 100% company-paid for the employee. Dependents are eligible to participate.Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account options.Dental, Vision, Life, Accident, and Disability insurance options.Paid Time Off for volunteering, wellness, and new parents.A Safe Harbor 401(k) plan that provides a 4% company match on a 5% employee contribution.4 1/2 day work week (half-day Fridays year-round!).Employee Wellness and Financial Assistance Resources through Mutual of Omaha and HoneyBee.On-Site Ergonomic and Physical Therapy servicesDiscounts on West Paw products!
What's It Like to Work at West Paw?West Paw is a small family-owned business with a strong history and new growth ahead. Through our diversified workforce, with most of us in one facility, we celebrate a collaborative, hardworking team. Our success stems from our values and vision and our willingness to learn and grow. We leverage Open Book Management allowing all employees to become better business people and to understand how they can further business success. We invest in financial literacy and transparency to engage employees to contribute to our current financial condition and future plans.
Our team is united in our quest for a cleaner planet, healthier communities, safe and happy pets, and transparent business practices. Everyone from production to sales to accounting and beyond rallies around our mission with a shared sense of purpose and pride. Our culture is built on relationships – with each other, our customers, our pets, our community, and our planet.
The joy of our work comes from sharing in success with people who are passionate about pets, contribute to our culture, appreciate a fast-paced atmosphere, share our values and further our vision.

title: Field Service Technician
description:
FIELD SERVICE TECHNICIAN - Northern suburbs of Minneapolis/St. Paul

Do you enjoy working with your hands and diagnosing problems? Are you a tech savvy person with mechanical aptitude who feels their skills are transferrable? Service Technicians create value for our customers by delivering solutions that build long term relationships. Acting as a first line response to our customers, you will triage customer issues, find the right solution, and even handle some problems before they start.

If this sounds like you, we would like to get to know you better!

NuSource implements cutting edge Branch Transformation, Security and Service solutions for the financial institution vertical supported by a world class service team. Our mission is to consistently deliver value-added consultative solutions and quality service experiences based on our core values of Integrity, Professionalism, and Teamwork. Our Net Promoter Score is consistently in the mid-80’s, which far exceeds anyone in our industry. NuSource is employee-owned and everyone who works for us has the opportunity to become an owner.

Primary Function/Summary

Perform installation services to customer specifications within timeline and budget parameters. Respond to and resolve requests for service of security, conventional, ATM, and ITM equipment. Complete preventative maintenance work as prescribed.

Provide a world class customer experience!

Perform low voltage job duties such as wiring, mounting and setup of electronic security installations (Video Surveillance, Access Control Systems, Security Alarm Systems, Phone Entry Systems, etc.)Service access control, video surveillance, security alarm, pneumatic systems, drive through audio systems, locks, and keys.Install and service customer ATM banking equipment.Diagnose hardware and software problems and complete needed repair and resolutionComplete preventative maintenance check-ups as defined by maintenance contractComplete site surveys as necessary to validate conditions in support of project bids and proposalsDocument/complete all fields and call notes via electronic applications for each service callCommunicate activity and status to manager, dispatch, customer and others as neededMaintain company van and tools in good working order (company expense)Interact with customer in a professional and proficient manner


Skills And Qualifications

Required:

title: SBDC Business Consultant
description:
The Business Consultant fosters a strong climate for small business growth by providing in-depth, confidential, no-cost business counseling, no-to-low-cost training, and resource and referral services to small business owners and aspiring entrepreneurs. Office hours are held at Tarleton State University SBDC in Stephenville and in stakeholder facilities within service area of Brown, Comanche, Erath, Hamilton, Mills, and Somervell counties. Mon-Fri; 8 AM-5 PM. Occasionally work requirements may include afterhours/late hours. 
The Business Consultant fosters a strong climate for small business growth by providing in-depth, confidential, no-cost business counseling, no-to-low-cost training, and resource and referral services to small business owners and aspiring entrepreneurs.
ResponsibilitiesSmall Business Counseling, Training, and Reporting Requirements:Assess client needs.Provide in counseling that includes feasibility, financial, regulatory, and operational guidance and technical assistance on the various aspects of starting and expanding a successful small business including, but not limited to:analyzing the specific business and industry data in finance, marketing, management, and operations,providing guidance in the development of business plans and financial packages.calculating and interpreting historical and projected financial ratios.preparing pro forma cash flow and financial statements.troubleshooting to identify problems and areas for improvement,providing guidance on expansion to include employment requirements, foreign markets, government contracting, and technology commercialization.conducting quality-based assessments.providing information on federal, state, and local regulations and programs, andproviding guidance to pre-venture, start-up, or advanced stage existing businesses.Develop a resource network to be used in providing referrals to appropriate resources.Plan and lead no- to low-cost training on subjects relevant to small business start-up and growth.Recruit government, private and public entities, as well as businesses and businesspersons to provide voluntary training.Assist in the transfer of university-based knowledge to the small business community.Ensure timely and accurate counseling data input into NeoSerra client information management system.Other duties as assigned by the Center Director.
Program and Small Business Advocate:Promote the SBDC program and advocate for small business through presentations to communities and entities.Develop relationships with key stakeholders including, but not limited to, SBA, banks, chambers of commerce, economic development organizations, trade groups, educational institutions, legislators, and hosts.Develop appropriate advertising, promotion, and marketing materials, as needed.
Qualifications
Required Education and Experience:Bachelor’s degree. Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.Three years of relevant experience
Proven Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Oral/Written CommunicationsWillingness to LearnInterpersonal SkillsOrganizational SkillsCollaborationListening SkillsMulti-taskingCollaborationSmall Business ExperienceTechnologyProject Management ExperienceSales and MarketingFinancing/LendingFinance/ Accounting: Debt & Equity FinanceEconomic DevelopmentSafeguarding program confidentialityent system.Other duties as assigned by the Center Director.Program and Small Business Advocate:Promote the SBDC program and advocate for small business through presentations to communities and entities.Develop relationships with key stakeholders including, but not limited to, SBA, banks, chambers of commerce, economic development organizations, trade groups, educational institutions, legislators, and hosts.Develop appropriate advertising, promotion, and marketing materials, as needed.Miscellaneous:Attend regional and national meetings and conferences as required.Develop and provide specific information, reports and/or special services as requested or required by the SBA and the Director of the Center.
Preferred Education and Experience: B.A., B.S., or Masters Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or related fieldExperience in business ownership, business consulting or equivalent combination of education and experience which demonstrates the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary for this position.
This position requires the successful completion of the Association of Accredited Small Business Consultants (AASBC) course regardless of education or experience within the first six (6) months of employment.

title: Entry Level Account Manager – Relocation Department
description:
Entry Level Account Manager – Relocation Department (NOT REMOTE)
Position is full-time, in office only, beginning salary $40K. Sales incentives available.
OVERVIEW:Busy regional real estate company is looking for an Account Manager to support its Relocation Department. The Relocation Account Manager is responsible for the service, maintenance and productivity of relocation accounts by entering, assigning and updating incoming and outgoing referrals and company generated leads. They work closely with the agents to promote and support all outgoing referrals and assist the Relocation Director in developing strategies that will contribute to the growth and servicing of referral business. Additionally, the relocation account manager assists as needed in covering for the relocation director on Corporate Relocation and Affinity business segments.
EMPLOYEE QUALIFICATIONS:Extremely comfortable with basic online technology (websites, Google searches, portal navigation), data entering & reports generationKnowledge of real estate transactions preferred but not required.Exceptional organizational skills.Strong attention to accuracyIndependent problem solving ability.Ability to re-prioritize tasks as needed.Comfortable calling prospects.Desire for leadership and personal development.Goal oriented.Professional demeanor and attitude.Knowledge of Outlook, Microsoft Office products & Canva (preferred).
RESPONSIBILITIES:Reports to Relocation Director.Receives and assigns all incoming and outgoing requests.Conducts online searches to identify possible partnering brokerages for customers referrals.Proactively follows up with agents for status updates to keep files current.Ensures commission disbursements are accurate and promptly remitted to admins.Keeps manager advised of operational problems and/or agent problems in a timely manner.Takes initiative to contact prospects as outlined by various business segment rules.Supports and promotes outgoing referrals through campaigns, recognition, bulletins and creates simple marketing flyers.Attends meetings and trainings as required.Reviews metrics with Relocation Director monthly to focus on achieving goals.Understands and supports company policies and procedures to provide proper and effective service to all customers and agents, and fosters the development of long term business relationships.
Position is full time, $40K salary. Sales incentives available. Available to start immediately.

title: Vice President of Marketing
description:
Ascend is the largest credit union in Middle Tennessee and one of the largest credit unions in the United States, with over $4 billion in assets. With an occupation-based field of membership, Ascend is focused on the expansion and diversification of the select employee groups it serves, which creates greater security for the credit union and its member-owners. Approximately 650 employees serve more than 260,000 members from 27 Middle Tennessee branch locations, Regional Operations Center, Teller Center and Corporate Headquarters. Ascend recognizes that its employees are critical to the credit union’s sustained success and future growth. Our employees are the face of the credit union and their personal successes fuel the success of the team. Through collaboration between employees, management, our membership and our Board, we fuel an engine that propels the credit union forward.

What We Offer

Thank you for your interest in a career with Ascend Federal Credit Union! Being employed by Ascend is vastly different than just holding a job. The credit union prides itself on providing employees rewarding career opportunities, competitive benefits and a unique work culture. The credit union’s commitment to its employees is fostered by its commitment to the member-owners, ensuring dedicated and engaged employees to serve the membership. Ascend’s vision to be the most loved credit union in our market by employees and members alike has earned the credit union distinctions including Federal Credit Union of the Year (NAFCU, 2015), Best Credit Union to Work For (2016-2023) and Training APEX Awards (2015-2024).

Overview

Reporting to the Chief Strategy Officer (CSO), the VP of Marketing is accountable and responsible for Ascend Marketing. Key responsibilities include, brand positioning, development and execution of marketing strategies, public relations, and member communications. The VP of Marketing works closely with peers to develop effective marketing plans that support Ascend's short and long-term goals. Manages an internal marketing team, leveraging staff, marketing platforms and 3rd party resources to maximize marketing performance. Ensures the marketing team is effectively leveraging data and insights to optimize performance. Accountable for member experience - ensuring consistent voice, cohesive messaging and optimal cadence of communications. Partners with department leaders and peers to implement communication platforms and processes that maximize subject matter expertise and responsiveness while maintaining a great member experience across accounts and products.

Responsibilities

 Accountable and responsible for brand awareness and brand positioning.  Accountable for development and execution of marketing strategies that support Ascend’s short and long-term goals.  Accountable for public relations. Including proactive and re-active efforts to manage brand and reputation.  Accountable for most all member communications. Communications are informational messages, provided as written content or visual content.  Accountable and responsible for the member experience, as it relates to managing the cadence, message, clarity and tone of marketing. Implement processes and training.  Develops a strong partnership with peers and department leaders. Develops marketing plans to support goals across the credit union.  Stays abreast of Marketing and Industry trends.  Stays abreast of regulatory changes.  Accountable for establishing standard “Key Performance Indicators” (KPIs) for measuring marketing performance, return on investment and impact to the business.  Forecasts campaign and media performance. Regularly provides forecast of estimated business impact or break-even. Measures results, comparing actual performance to forecasted performance.  Sets the example and expectation of using data to inform marketing plans and for continuous optimization amongst marketing staff and 3rd parties.  Accountable for management of Ascend’s public website – Ascend.org. This includes hosting, management, content, strategy/planning, performance, tagging and reporting as well as site security.  Accountable and responsible for Ascend’s Tagging Strategy and Reporting including the funnel analysis for applications, opening accounts online, and campaign performance.  Accountable and responsible for a variety of marketing channels, platforms, 3rd parties and tactics including: public website, paid digital media, organic digital media, traditional media, direct marketing, signage, print, visual/video, marketing in digital banking, event marketing, and more.  Accountable for in-house production and management of Ascend’s photography and video needs. This includes headshots, marketing videos, how-to-videos, employee messages, hiring videos and more.  Establishes a robust project support system to support the demands of the credit union. Effectively allocating time (on average 15-20% of time, fluctuates based on needs) and tracking staff time to assist with strategic project work. These are approved projects managed by Ascend’s Project Portfolio Manager. Marketing support is typically development of content, collateral or communications as projects are often “new” or “enhanced” capabilities.  Proactively manages and helps prioritize the volume of ad-hoc requests “creative service requests” that come from other departments. Champions process and procedures for project management.  Propose and efficiently manage Ascend’s multi-million-dollar marketing budget in support of Ascend’s goals.  Prepare performance evaluations for employees and make recommendations for raises, promotions, disciplinary action, or termination. Discuss and set professional goals with each employee. Check and verify employees' timecards. Prepare employee work schedules or assign as needed. Perform quality control on work produced by direct reports for accuracy.  Provides leadership, coaching and development opportunities for staff. Sets a strong example, provides clear direction, employee training, and constructive feedback.  Manage 3rd party resources effectively. Hold resources accountable, ensure contracts and SOWs are well vetted, negotiate pricing, and ensure quality delivery of product or service.  Read all internal publications such as HUB and Possibilities.  Perform other duties as required or assigned. 

Qualifications

 Bachelor's Degree required and  Master's Degree preferred  10-15 years of proven success in marketing, communications, public relations, product or sales required  Confident, driven, dynamic leader with a proven track record of success in marketing roles and has a passion for continuous improvement.  Proven leader with analytical and creative strengths. Strong analytical and project management skills to measure ROI, forecast, and identify trends and challenges. Strong creative outlook, ability to think creatively and innovatively.  Demonstrable experience in developing efficient strategies and business plans for all aspects of marketing.  Intimate understanding of traditional and emerging marketing channels. Familiarity with the latest trends, technologies and methodologies in graphic design, web design, production, etc.  Must be able to exercise professional judgment, discretion, initiative, tact, friendliness and patience during frequent contact with sponsor groups, vendors, membership, staff, supervisors and management team whether in the field or back office.  Superior communication, writing and editing skills and ability to demonstrate versatility in writing formats, including online. Exceptional skills related to telephone, interpersonal, written, and public speaking communication. Must be able to articulate ideas in a friendly, open, up-beat manner utilizing meticulous grammar, word choice, spelling and punctuation to build trust and rapport with all audiences.  Proven experience measuring marketing ROI and leveraging tests and insights to improve marketing performance.  High degree of organizational ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and completely while meeting deadlines.  Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to spot original branding opportunities.  Experience with Search Engine Optimization and Search Marketing Optimization.  Possession of a valid, unrestricted driver’s license.  Proficient in Microsoft Office software applications. Familiarity with Adobe programs including Illustrator, Pro and Acrobat. Familiarity with HTML code and working with a WYSIWYG system for Webmaster tasks. Able to effectively use office machinery including a PC, telephone, calculator, and multifunction copier.  Background in digital audience analysis, market research, and web analytics. Google Analytics preferred.  Preferred expertise in social media and electronic marketing platforms (Web and email) to aid in ability to develop and manage vendor relationships (printer, Web site host, multi-media provider, etc.)  Regular and reliable attendance is required. 

 Connect With Us 

Connect with us on social media such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn Ascend Federal Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Instructor, Computer Information Technology

This is a full-time regular position.
Courses are focused on but are not limited to Windows Command Prompt, Linux Command Line, basic PowerShell, IT Fundamentals, Programming Logic, and Networking Concepts. 
Southeast Community College offers competitive compensation and a robust benefits package, including, but not limited to: medical/dental insurance, 403(b) retirement with College matching contribution, vision insurance, flexible spending account, and tuition reimbursement.
